text: Communication with satellites shall happen using X-band frequencies
The system must handle multiple simultaneous connections
The ground station shall process uplink commands within 50ms
The ground station must monitor satellite health telemetry continuously tracking temperature voltage and orientation data
The system must generate alerts when anomalies are detected
Uplink data rate: 10 Mbps minimum
Downlink data rate: 50 Mbps minimum
Command latency: < 50ms
Signal acquisition: < 5 seconds
Concurrent satellites: 10 maximum
The system shall maintain connection logs for audit purposes
When a satellite goes out of range, the system should queue commands for later transmission
The system must detect transmission errors and automatically retry failed commands up to 3 times before alerting operators
Error rates shall not exceed 0.1% under normal conditions
Historical data going back 5 years is required for trend analysis
The database shall be backed up daily
Backup retention is 10 years minimum for regulatory compliance
The system will communicate with the Mission Control System via TCP/IP using a custom protocol
The system shall provide a REST API for external monitoring tools
The system must support webhook notifications for critical events
The ground station equipment shall operate on standard 110V/220V power
The system shall include UPS backup providing at least 4 hours of operation during power outages
The system must continue operating in extreme weather conditions including temperatures from -20C to +50C
The system must operate in humidity up to 95%
The system must operate in wind speeds up to 100 km/h
The system shall support remote diagnostics and firmware updates without requiring physical access
The system shall implement frequency hopping and power control features
Real-time visualization of satellite orbits shall be displayed on a 3D globe interface
Mission data shall be archived to offline storage after 90 days of online retention
